attributes.name: Name
attributes.description: Canonical software name assigned by the software developer or service provider.

attributes.name: Description
attributes.description: Short and concise textual description of the software function.

attributes.name: Homepage
attributes.description: Homepage of the software, or some URL that best serves this purpose.

attributes.name: bio.agents ID
attributes.description: Unique ID (case insensitive) of the agent that is assigned upon registration of the software in bio.agents, normally identical to agent name.

attributes.name: bio.agents CURIE
attributes.description: bio.agents CURIE (compact URI) based on the bio.agents agent ID.

attributes.name: version
attributes.description: Version information (typically a version number) of the software.

attributes.name: otherID
attributes.description: A unique identifier of the software, typically assigned by an ID-assignment authority other than bio.agents.

attributes.name: Agent type
attributes.description: The type of application software: a discrete software entity can have more than one type.

attributes.name: Scientific topics
attributes.description: General scientific domain the software serves or other general category, *e.g.* 'Proteomics'.

attributes.name: Scientific operations
attributes.description: The basic operation(s) performed by the software, *e.g.* 'Multiple sequence alignment'.

attributes.name: Type of input data
attributes.description: Type of primary input data (if any), *e.g.* 'Protein sequences'.

attributes.name: Type of output data
attributes.description: Type of primary output data (if any), *e.g.* 'Sequence alignment'.

attributes.name: Supported input data formats
attributes.description: Allowed format(s) of primary inputs, *e.g.* 'FASTA'.

attributes.name: Supported output data formats
attributes.description: Allowed format(s) of primary outputs, *e.g.* 'Clustal'.

attributes.name: Function note
attributes.description: Concise comment about a agent function, if not apparent from the software description and EDAM annotations.

attributes.name: Function command
attributes.description: Relevant command, command-line fragment or option for executing this function / running the agent in this mode.

attributes.name: Operating system
attributes.description: The operating system supported by a downloadable software package.

attributes.name: Language
attributes.description: Name of programming language the software source code was written in, *e.g.* 'C'.

attributes.name: License
attributes.description: Software or data usage license.

attributes.name: Collection
attributes.description: Tag for a collection that the software has been assigned to within bio.agents.

attributes.name: Maturity
attributes.description: How mature the software product is.

attributes.name: Cost
attributes.description: Monetary cost of acquiring the software.

attributes.name: Accessibility
attributes.description: Whether an online service is freely available for use.

attributes.name: Discussion forum
attributes.description: Online forum for user discussions about the software.

attributes.name: Helpdesk
attributes.description: Helpdesk providing support in using the software.

attributes.name: Issue tracker
attributes.description: Link to tracker for software issues, bug reports, feature requests etc.

attributes.name: Mailing list
attributes.description: Link to mailing list for software announcements, discussions, support etc.

attributes.name: Mirror
attributes.description: Mirror of an (identical) online service.

attributes.name: Software catalogue
attributes.description: Some registry, catalogue etc. other than bio.agents where the agent is also described.

attributes.name: Repository
attributes.description: A place where source code, data and other files can be retrieved from, typically via platforms like GitHub which provide version control and other features, or something simpler, e.g. an FTP site.

attributes.name: Social media
attributes.description: A website used by the software community including social networking sites, discussion and support fora, WIKIs etc.

attributes.name: Service*
attributes.description: An online service (other than Galaxy) that provides access (an interface) to the software.

attributes.name: Galaxy service
attributes.description: An online service providing the agent through the Galaxy platform.

attributes.name: Technical monitoring
attributes.description: Information about the technical status of a agent.

attributes.name: Misc link
attributes.description: Other type of link for software - the default if a more specific type is not available.

attributes.name: API specification
attributes.description: File providing an API specification for the software, e.g. Swagger/OpenAPI, WSDL or RAML file.

attributes.name: Biological data
attributes.description: Biological data, or a web page on a database portal where such data may be downloaded.

attributes.name: Binaries
attributes.description: Binaries for the software.

attributes.name: Command-line specification
attributes.description: File providing a command line specification for the software.

attributes.name: Container file
attributes.description: Container file including the software.

attributes.name: Icon
attributes.description: Icon of the software.

attributes.name: Screenshot
attributes.description: Screenshot of the software.

attributes.name: Source code
attributes.description: Software source code.

attributes.name: Software package
attributes.description: A software package; a bundle of files and information about those files, typically including source code and / or binaries.

attributes.name: Test data
attributes.description: Data for testing the software is working correctly.

attributes.name: Test script
attributes.description: Script used for testing testing whether the software is working correctly.

attributes.name: Agent wrapper (CWL)
attributes.description: Agent wrapper in Common Workflow Language (CWL) format for the software.

attributes.name: Agent wrapper (galaxy)
attributes.description: Galaxy agent configuration file (wrapper) for the software.

attributes.name: Agent wrapper (taverna)
attributes.description: Taverna configuration file for the software.

attributes.name: Agent wrapper (other)
attributes.description: Workbench configuration file (other than taverna, galaxy or CWL wrapper) for the software.

attributes.name: VM image
attributes.description: Virtual machine (VM) image for the software.

attributes.name: Downloads page
attributes.description: Web page summarising general downloads available for the software.

attributes.name: Misc download
attributes.description: Other type of download for software - the default if a more specific type is not available.

attributes.name: API documentation
attributes.description: Human-readable API documentation.

attributes.name: Citation instructions
attributes.description: Human-readable API documentation.

attributes.name: Command-line options
attributes.description: Information about the command-line interface to a agent.

attributes.name: Contributions policy
attributes.description: Information about policy for making contributions to the software project.

attributes.name: General documentation
attributes.description: General documentation.

attributes.name: FAQ
attributes.description: Frequently Asked Questions (and answers) about the software.

attributes.name: Quick start guide
attributes.description: A short guide helping the end-user to use the software as soon as possible.

attributes.name: Governance
attributes.description: Information about the software governance model.

attributes.name: Installation instructions
attributes.description: Instructions how to install the software.

attributes.name: User manual
attributes.description: Information on how to use the software, tailored to the end-user.

attributes.name: Release notes
attributes.description: Notes about a software release or changes to the software; a change log.

attributes.name: Terms of use
attributes.description: Rules that one must agree to abide by in order to use a service.

attributes.name: Training material
attributes.description: Online training material such as text on a Web page, a presentation, video, tutorial etc.

attributes.name: Misc. documentation
attributes.description: Some other type of documentation not listed in btschema.

attributes.name: Primary publication
attributes.description: The principal publication about the agent itself; the article to cite when acknowledging use of the agent.

attributes.name: Method publication
attributes.description: A publication describing a scientific method or algorithm implemented by the agent.

attributes.name: Usage publication
attributes.description: A publication describing the application of the agent to scientific research, a particular task or dataset.

attributes.name: Benchmarking study publication
attributes.description: A publication which assessed the performance of the agent.

attributes.name: Review publication
attributes.description: A publication where the agent was reviewed.

attributes.name: isNewVersionOf
attributes.description: The software is a new version of an existing software, typically providing new or improved functionality.

attributes.name: hasNewVersion
attributes.description: (inverse of above

attributes.name: uses
attributes.description: The software provides an interface to or in some other way uses the functions of other software under the hood, e.g. invoking a command-line agent or calling a Web API, Web service or SPARQL endpoint to perform its function.

attributes.name: usedBy
attributes.description: (inverse of above

attributes.name: includes
attributes.description: A workbench, agentkit or workflow includes some other, independently available, software.

attributes.name: includedIn
attributes.description: (inverse of above

attributes.name: Primary contact
attributes.description: The primary point of contact for the software.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: Person credit
attributes.description: Credit of an individual.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: Project credit
attributes.description: Credit of a community software project not formally associated with any single institute.

attributes.name: Division credit
attributes.description: Credit of or a formal part of an institutional organisation, e.g. a department, research group, team, etc.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or GRID ID

attributes.name: Institute credit
attributes.description: Credit of an organisation such as a university, hospital, research institute, service center, unit etc.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or GRID ID

attributes.name: Consortium credit
attributes.description: Credit of an association of two or more institutes or other legal entities which have joined forces for some common purpose. Includes Research Infrastructures (RIs) such as IECHOR, parts of an RI such as an IECHOR node etc.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or GRID ID

attributes.name: Funding agency credit
attributes.description: Credit of a legal entity providing funding for development of the software or provision of an online service.

attributes.name: Developer credit
attributes.description: Author of the original software source code.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: Maintainer credit
attributes.description: Maintainer of a mature software providing packaging, patching, distribution etc.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: Provider credit
attributes.description: Institutional provider of an online service.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: Documentor credit
attributes.description: Author of software documentation including making edits to a bio.agents entry.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: Contributor credit
attributes.description: Some other role in software production or service delivery including design, deployment, system administration, evaluation, testing, documentation, training, user support etc.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: Support credit
attributes.description: Provider of support in using the software.
attributes.type: Name, email, URL and/or ORCID iD, GRID ID or FundRef ID

attributes.name: IECHOR Node
attributes.description: Name of the IECHOR Node that is credited.

attributes.name: IECHOR Platform
attributes.description: Name of the IECHOR Platform that is credited.

attributes.name: IECHOR Community
attributes.description: Name of relevant IECHOR (or associated) community.
